title: Norway’s crown princess had years of contact with Epstein, files suggest
description: Mette-Marit apologises for ‘poor judgment’ as documents reportedly include scores of email exchanges with child sex offender
content:
Norway’s crown princess has become embroiled in another scandal after newly unsealed files appeared to show her years of extensive contact with the late child sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.
The latest tranche of Epstein files, released on Friday by th... [3132 chars]

title: Sri Lanka v England: Tom Banton's unbeaten half-century secures victory by six wickets in DLS chase in second T20 international in Pallekele
description: Tom Banton hits an unbeaten half-century as England pull off a brilliant DLS chase to beat Sri Lanka by six wickets in the second T20 international.
content:
Tom Banton whacked an unbeaten half-century as England pulled off a brilliant DLS chase to beat Sri Lanka by six wickets in the second T20 international.
The players had gone off for rain with England 57-2 off 7.2 overs - Phil Salt and Jacob Bethell ... [3966 chars]

title: Aryna Sabalenka’s soul-searching goes on after Australian Open final collapse
description: The world No 1 has won four and lost four grand slam finals but manner of some of those defeats leaves questions to be answered
content: An hour after another excruciating loss in a significant final, Aryna Sabalenka was asked about her record in grand slam finals. She responded by lamenting the fact that she had lost the majority of those she had played. She was mistaken. Her bitter ... [3793 chars]

title: UK should consider resuming talks on EU defence pact, Starmer says
description: PM says Europe must ‘step up’ and signals he wants to work more closely with other states to build military capability
content:
The UK should consider re-entering talks for a defence pact with the EU, Keir Starmer has said, arguing that Europe needs to “step up and do more” to defend itself in uncertain times.

title: Aston Villa’s title hopes dealt blow by 10-man Brentford amid VAR drama
description: Aston Villa were beaten 1-0 at home by Brentford, Dango Ouattara’s brilliant strike settling the game despite Kevin Schade’s red card for the visitors
content:
Aston Villa were already angry at trailing to 10-man Brentford and then, four minutes into the second half, those frustrations grew tenfold.
